author: nflaig
content:
> fall back to empty string if neither
Empty string is a valid value for the graffiti, I would rather see the keymanager return an error if neither a pubkey specific nor a system-wide graffiti is set

> This is one thing that's probably worth discussing (whether the watermark should be returned as part of this query)
How would you determine the watermark from the validator client? There is no standarized api to retrieve this value from the beacon node, and if the validator client is connected to multiple nodes it's not possible to know the value until the actual proposal happens.

author: .paulharris
content:
I'd have to re-check if there's also a code, but Im not super worried about that specific case (empty string), my hope would be this is a sanity check, not your only source of information, generally speaking its a configured value you'd be expecting to see IMO.
The watermark changes every release, so unless we have an endpoint for that too, its dependent on the size of your graffiti. I'm not super worried if people can't see what it actually is at this point - so many clients weren't even watermarking by default (last time i checked teku was it) it also seems very edge casey.
The rules for the watermarking are fairly well defined so it's easy to reason on what would happen, and IMO explorers once it's common should probably just filter the data anyway to display in a better format.

author: .paulharris
content: I'm glad that we used unique codes for clients though, so it's resistant to positional bias - lighthouse and teku appear to display clients in the oposite order :/
